title: Seriously, leave Veigar alone
body:
I leave for a week and see that my longtime main's public opinion has gone from perma-"HE IS SO UNDERPOWERED! BUFF HIM" on the boards to "OMG! HE IS SO OVERPOWERED! HE NEEDS TO BE FIXED!".

Riot literally only reduced the delay on his W by .25 seconds and allowed him to more reliably get AP (giving him about 25 - 60 more in the late game, depending on how well you are doing). He has not changed that massively. Just cuz you got dumped on by a Veigar because you couldn't take advantage of his GLARING weaknesses doesn't make him OP. Those changes were honestly good for him and puts him in a perfect place of power; where he can still fail hard if he gets shut down early game/zoned from his Q farm but do extremely well in the mid to late game if his team is competent enough to peel for the escapeless squishy bastard. He is everything a burst mage should be; he has reasonable trade-offs (his abysmally terrible early game) and specializes in late game damage dealing (along with some battlefield control with his E). He's not an unstoppable champion, he is practically an AP Nasus that dies MUCH easier (literally, if he doesn't have Zhonya's then the enemy team's assassins will make him regret walking outside that day); his largest counter is an item that is good on every champion too (Banshee's Veil).

Seriously, leave Veigar alone. It's not that he's OP, it's that the guy on the other team was better than you.

Veigar is fine, his weaknesses are super easy to comprehend and, IMO, once you know his general rotation alongside learning to not overextend against him will lead to a not-lost-and-potentially-won lane. 

When I'm jungling or spectating, I notice the number one cause of people dying to Veigar's Stun+Kit is because of stupidity/lack of information; either he played against their unknowing (as all good players do) or they literally ran into his stun. 

Then there's the classical "I wanted to harass and got so close to him with AAs as a mage that I couldn't dodge his cage" deal. Veigar might be one of the most telegraphic mages in the game and he's ridiculously easy to predict.
You act as if the 0.25s reduction is a small buff, if that was the case he wouldn't have suddently rose up to 53.5% win rate.

I'd say that it was more his ability to get 5 AP on an assist without needing to get a kill that buffed him more than his w change. The w change only made landing his w on a rank 1 stunned target easier/more reliable.
5 AP for assist does have an effect, but it's minimal compared to the gains he has by making his W easier to land.

The 0.25s was necessary I remember playing veigar and watching all my mid lane opponents build mercury treads. I would never be able to hit an e+w unless I had a stun 100% confirmed and threw my w out immediately.
